meanings.definition: The action or process of accustoming or becoming accustomed to something.
meanings.sent1: Her accustomation to the new school took some time, but she eventually felt comfortable.
meanings.sent2: After years of practice, his accustomation to playing the piano was evident in his flawless performance.
meanings.sent3: The accustomation of the cat to wearing a leash was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: His accustomation to the fast-paced city life was like diving into a whirlpool of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The accustomation of the plant to its new environment was a slow but steady process.

meanings.definition: The state of being accustomed to something.
meanings.sent1: The accustomation of the students to the school's rules was essential for a harmonious learning environment.
meanings.sent2: His accustomation to waking up early every day made him a morning person.
meanings.sent3: The accustomation of the dog to wearing sunglasses was a hilarious sight.
meanings.sent4: Her accustomation to the cold weather was like a warm blanket of familiarity.
meanings.sent5: The accustomation of the baby to solid foods was a messy but adorable process.
